description: The bodies of Andre and Naomi Howell were discovered at a townhouse in the Lansdowne area of Leesburg, Virginia, at around 9pm yesterday.
title: Virginia naval officer husband 'kills high school sweetheart in murder-suicide'
title_page: Virginia naval officer husband 'kills high school sweetheart in murder-suicide' | Daily Mail Online
text:
Naomi Howell (pictured) is believed to have been murdered by her husband Andre who then took his own life
A husband murdered his high school sweetheart wife before committing suicide while their four-year-old was in the house.
The bodies of Andre, 40, and Naomi Howell, 39, were discovered at a townhouse in the Lansdowne area of Leesburg, Virginia, at around 9pm yesterday, WUSA 9 reports.
A Loudoun County Sheriff’s Department spokesman confirmed that the married couple had died from gunshot wounds.
Deputies had been responding to a 911 call from a neighbor who had reported a suspected suicide at the 19200 block of Winmeade Drive.
When police arrived they found the bodies and the couple's young daughter who was unharmed.
It is believed that the husband shot his wife dead before taking his own life, KHOU reports.
Neighbors told the channel that the couple appeared to have been having relationship problems and were often heard arguing.
Their family pastor confirmed the couple had been high school sweethearts and had sought counselling for their issues before the incident.
A man and woman have been killed in a suspected domestic murder-suicide at a Virginia townhouse (pictured) police say
A man and woman have been killed in domestic murder-suicide at a Virginia townhouse in the 19200 block of Winmeade Drive (pictured)
Police have not yet released the names of the victims.
A Loudoun County Sheriff Office spokesman confirmed they believe the incident to be 'domestic in nature and was contained to the home.'
